revised_title: Review of Recent Developments in Cosmology: The Bakerian Lecture, 1968
tldr: In this Bakerian Lecture, F. Hoyle reviews recent developments in cosmology, focusing on the big bang and steady-state theories. He discusses the importance of symmetry postulates, homogeneity, and isotropy in understanding the expansion and contraction of the universe. Hoyle also examines the red-shift-distance relationship, the origin of chemical elements, and the Stebbins-Whitford effect, which were significant challenges to the steady-state theory.
